canonical_explanation.text: The area of a parallelogram is base x height. The area of a triangle is 1/2 x base x height. The circumference of a circle is 2 x pi x r (or pi x d), and the area of a circle is pi x r^2. We use pi = 22/7 or 3.14. Composite figures can be broken into simpler shapes whose areas are added or subtracted. Area of a rectangle = length x breadth, and area of a square = side x side.
rules: Area of rectangle = length x breadth
Area of square = side x side
Area of parallelogram = base x height
Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height
Circumference of circle = 2 x pi x r = pi x d
Area of circle = pi x r^2
Area of path = Area of outer region - Area of inner region

questions.question_text: The area of a parallelogram with base 8 cm and height 5 cm is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area of parallelogram = base x height = 8 x 5 = 40 sq cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = base x height = 8 x 5 = 40 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram has a base of 12 cm and a height of 7 cm. Its area is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area = base x height = 12 x 7 = 84 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a parallelogram with base 10 cm and height 6 cm is ___ sq cm.
questions.explanation_correct: Area = base x height = 10 x 6 = 60 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The height of a parallelogram is the:

options.text: Perpendicular distance between the base and the opposite side

questions.explanation_correct: The height of a parallelogram is the perpendicular distance from the base to the opposite parallel side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Height = perpendicular distance between base and opposite side.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram has an area of 96 sq cm and a base of 12 cm. What is its height?
questions.explanation_correct: Area = base x height. 96 = 12 x height. Height = 96/12 = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram has an area of 72 sq cm and a height of 9 cm. What is the length of its base?
questions.explanation_correct: Area = base x height. 72 = base x 9. Base = 72/9 = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a triangle with base 10 cm and height 6 cm is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height = 1/2 x 10 x 6 = 30 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A triangle has a base of 14 cm and a height of 8 cm. Its area is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 1/2 x base x height = 1/2 x 14 x 8 = 56 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a triangle with base 12 cm and height 5 cm is ___ sq cm.
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 1/2 x 12 x 5 = 30 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a triangle is exactly half the area of a parallelogram with the same base and height.
questions.explanation_correct: Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height, and area of parallelogram = base x height. So the triangle's area is exactly half that of the parallelogram with the same base and height.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Triangle area = (1/2) x parallelogram area, when base and height are equal.

questions.question_text: A triangle has an area of 48 sq cm and a base of 16 cm. What is its height?
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 1/2 x base x height. 48 = 1/2 x 16 x height. 48 = 8 x height. Height = 6 cm.

questions.question_text: A triangle has an area of 35 sq cm and a height of 7 cm. The base of the triangle is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 1/2 x base x height. 35 = 1/2 x base x 7. 35 = 3.5 x base. Base = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: The circumference of a circle with radius 7 cm is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = 2 x pi x r = 2 x (22/7) x 7 = 44 cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a circle with radius 7 cm is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Area = pi x r^2 = (22/7) x 7 x 7 = 22 x 7 = 154 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The circumference of a circle with diameter 14 cm is ___ cm. (Use pi = 22/7)
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = pi x d = (22/7) x 14 = 44 cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a circle with radius 14 cm is (use pi = 22/7):
The circumference of a circle with radius 21 cm is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = 2 x pi x r = 2 x (22/7) x 21 = 2 x 66 = 132 cm.

questions.question_text: A circular garden has a diameter of 28 m. The cost of fencing it at Rs 5 per metre is:
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = pi x d = (22/7) x 28 = 88 m. Cost = 88 x 5 = Rs 440.

questions.question_text: The area of a circle with diameter 10 cm is (use pi = 3.14):
questions.explanation_correct: Radius = 10/2 = 5 cm. Area = pi x r^2 = 3.14 x 25 = 78.5 sq cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: r = 5 cm. Area = 3.14 x 25 = 78.5 sq cm.

questions.question_text: If the circumference of a circle is 44 cm, its radius is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = 2 x pi x r. 44 = 2 x (22/7) x r. 44 = (44/7) x r. r = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: If the area of a circle is 154 sq cm, its radius is (use pi = 22/7):
A rectangular park is 50 m long and 30 m wide. A path of 2 m width runs along the outside. The area of the path is:
questions.explanation_correct: Outer dimensions: (50+4) x (30+4) = 54 x 34 = 1836 sq m. Inner area = 50 x 30 = 1500 sq m. Path area = 1836 - 1500 = 336 sq m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Outer area = 54 x 34 = 1836 sq m. Path area = 1836 - 1500 = 336 sq m.

questions.question_text: A rectangular field is 80 m long and 60 m wide. A path 5 m wide runs inside along the boundary. The area of the path is:
questions.explanation_correct: Outer area = 80 x 60 = 4800 sq m. Inner dimensions: (80-10) x (60-10) = 70 x 50 = 3500 sq m. Path area = 4800 - 3500 = 1300 sq m.

questions.question_text: A figure is made of a rectangle of dimensions 10 cm x 6 cm with a semicircle on one of the shorter sides. The total area is (use pi = 3.14):
questions.explanation_correct: Rectangle area = 10 x 6 = 60 sq cm. Semicircle radius = 6/2 = 3 cm. Semicircle area = (1/2) x pi x r^2 = (1/2) x 3.14 x 9 = 14.13 sq cm. Total = 60 + 14.13 = 74.13 sq cm.

questions.question_text: Two parallelograms have the same base of 10 cm. If their heights are 4 cm and 6 cm respectively, what is the ratio of their areas?
questions.explanation_correct: Area 1 = 10 x 4 = 40 sq cm. Area 2 = 10 x 6 = 60 sq cm. Ratio = 40 : 60 = 2 : 3.

questions.question_text: The area of a right triangle with legs 6 cm and 8 cm is:
questions.explanation_correct: In a right triangle, the two legs serve as base and height. Area = 1/2 x 6 x 8 = 24 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A triangular plot has a base of 20 m and a height of 15 m. The cost of levelling the plot at Rs 8 per sq m is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 1/2 x 20 x 15 = 150 sq m. Cost = 150 x 8 = Rs 1200.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = 150 sq m. Cost = 150 x 8 = Rs 1200.

questions.question_text: A wheel has a radius of 35 cm. How many revolutions does it make to cover a distance of 220 m? (Use pi = 22/7)
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference = 2 x (22/7) x 35 = 220 cm = 2.2 m. Number of revolutions = 220 / 2.2 = 100.

questions.question_text: To find the area of a path around a rectangular field, we calculate:

options.text: Area of outer rectangle - Area of inner rectangle
Perimeter of the rectangle x width of path
Area of outer rectangle + Area of inner rectangle

questions.explanation_correct: The area of the path = Area of the outer rectangle (field + path) - Area of the inner rectangle (field only).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Path area = Outer area - Inner area.

questions.question_text: A square garden of side 20 m has a 2 m wide path running inside along its boundary. The area of the path is:
questions.explanation_correct: Outer area = 20 x 20 = 400 sq m. Inner side = 20 - 2 - 2 = 16 m. Inner area = 16 x 16 = 256 sq m. Path area = 400 - 256 = 144 sq m.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram and a rectangle have the same base 15 cm and the same area of 120 sq cm. The height of the parallelogram is:
questions.explanation_correct: Area = base x height. 120 = 15 x height. Height = 120/15 = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: If the base of a parallelogram is doubled and the height is halved, the area:
questions.explanation_correct: New area = (2b) x (h/2) = b x h = original area. The area remains the same.

questions.question_text: If the base and height of a triangle are both doubled, its area becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: New area = 1/2 x (2b) x (2h) = 1/2 x 4bh = 4 x (1/2 x b x h) = 4 times the original area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1/2 x 2b x 2h = 2bh = 4 x (1/2 bh). Area becomes 4 times.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram ABCD has base AB = 16 cm and height = 9 cm. Triangle ABD is formed by diagonal BD. The area of triangle ABD is:
questions.explanation_correct: A diagonal divides a parallelogram into two equal triangles. Area of parallelogram = 16 x 9 = 144 sq cm. Area of triangle ABD = 144/2 = 72 sq cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonal divides parallelogram into 2 equal triangles. Each = 144/2 = 72 sq cm.

questions.question_text: If the radius of a circle is doubled, its area becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: New area = pi x (2r)^2 = pi x 4r^2 = 4 x (pi x r^2) = 4 times the original area.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = pi(2r)^2 = 4 pi r^2 = 4 times original.

questions.question_text: The ratio of the area of a circle to the area of a square with the same perimeter is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Let perimeter = P. For circle: 2 pi r = P, so r = P/(2 pi). Area = pi r^2 = pi x P^2/(4 pi^2) = P^2/(4 pi). For square: 4s = P, s = P/4. Area = P^2/16. Ratio = [P^2/(4 pi)] : [P^2/16] = 16/(4 pi) = 4/pi = 4/(22/7) = 28/22 = 14/11 = 14 : 11.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circle area / Square area = 4/pi = 14/11. So ratio = 14 : 11.

questions.question_text: The area of a ring (annulus) with outer radius 10 cm and inner radius 6 cm is (use pi = 22/7):
A rectangular garden 40 m x 30 m has a circular fountain of radius 7 m in the centre. The area of the garden excluding the fountain is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Garden area = 40 x 30 = 1200 sq m. Fountain area = (22/7) x 49 = 154 sq m. Remaining area = 1200 - 154 = 1046 sq m.

questions.question_text: Convert 3 sq m to sq cm:
questions.explanation_correct: 1 m = 100 cm. 1 sq m = 10000 sq cm. 3 sq m = 30000 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The area of a parallelogram depends on the length of its sides, not the height.
questions.explanation_correct: The area of a parallelogram = base x height. It depends on the base and the perpendicular height, not just the lengths of the sides. Two parallelograms with the same sides but different heights have different areas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area = base x height. The height (perpendicular distance) is crucial, not just the side lengths.

questions.question_text: Which formula gives the area of a triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: The area of a triangle = 1/2 x base x height.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Area of triangle = 1/2 x base x height.

questions.question_text: The value of pi is approximately:
questions.explanation_correct: Pi is the ratio of circumference to diameter of any circle. Its approximate value is 3.14159... or about 22/7.

questions.question_text: A field in the shape of a parallelogram has a base of 25 m and a height of 12 m. If 1 kg of fertilizer is needed per 10 sq m, how much fertilizer is needed?
questions.explanation_correct: Area = 25 x 12 = 300 sq m. Fertilizer = 300/10 = 30 kg.

questions.question_text: The area of a triangle is 120 sq cm. If its base is tripled and height is halved, the new area is:
questions.explanation_correct: New area = 1/2 x (3b) x (h/2) = (3bh)/4. Original area = bh/2 = 120, so bh = 240. New area = 3 x 240 / 4 = 180 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A figure is made of a square of side 10 cm with a triangle on top (base 10 cm, height 6 cm). The total area is:
questions.explanation_correct: Square area = 10 x 10 = 100 sq cm. Triangle area = 1/2 x 10 x 6 = 30 sq cm. Total = 100 + 30 = 130 sq cm.

questions.question_text: From a rectangular sheet of 20 cm x 14 cm, a circle of radius 7 cm is cut out. The area of the remaining sheet is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: Rectangle area = 20 x 14 = 280 sq cm. Circle area = (22/7) x 49 = 154 sq cm. Remaining = 280 - 154 = 126 sq cm.

questions.question_text: The minute hand of a clock is 14 cm long. The area swept by it in 30 minutes is (use pi = 22/7):
questions.explanation_correct: In 30 minutes, the minute hand sweeps half a circle. Area = (1/2) x pi x r^2 = (1/2) x (22/7) x 196 = (1/2) x 616 = 308 sq cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Half circle area = (1/2) x (22/7) x 14^2 = 308 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A verandah 2 m wide is built along the outside of a room 6 m x 4 m. The area of the verandah is:
questions.explanation_correct: Outer length = 6 + 2 + 2 = 10 m, outer width = 4 + 2 + 2 = 8 m. Outer area = 10 x 8 = 80 sq m. Inner area = 6 x 4 = 24 sq m. Verandah area = 80 - 24 = 56 sq m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Outer = 10 x 8 = 80 sq m. Verandah = 80 - 24 = 56 sq m.

questions.question_text: The area of a semicircle with radius 7 cm is ___ sq cm. (Use pi = 22/7)
questions.explanation_correct: Area of semicircle = (1/2) x pi x r^2 = (1/2) x (22/7) x 49 = (1/2) x 154 = 77 sq cm.

questions.question_text: A circular track has an outer radius of 21 m and an inner radius of 14 m. The area of the track is (use pi = 22/7):
